logician.goal: Validate the feasibility of the provided plan for Scenario A (S1), identify any missing or implicit preconditions and effects, and highlight dependencies that affect Scenario B (S2).

world_modeler.goal: Extract a clean, normalized planning model from the human description: list all predicates, objects, action schemas with parameters, and map natural-language facts to PDDL-style predicate signatures, without emitting PDDL.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' analyses and produce a final PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem (Scenario B) compatible with the FastDownward solver. The domain must encode the six actions and their preconditions/effects as described. The problem must contain the Scenario B initial state and goals.

public_information: Objects are named object_0, object_1, object_2, ..., and so on; actions take parameters aligned with these names.
Available actions and arities: paltry(?o0 ?o1 ?o2), sip(?o0 ?o1 ?o2), clip(?o0 ?o1 ?o2), wretched(?o0 ?o1 ?o2 ?o3), memory(?o0 ?o1 ?o2), tightfisted(?o0 ?o1 ?o2).
Predicates mentioned: hand(?x), cats(?x), sneeze(?x), spring(?x), stupendous(?x), texture(?x), vase(?x ?y), next(?x ?y), collect(?x ?y).

paltry preconditions (must be true): hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, vase object_0 object_1, next object_1 object_2. paltry effects add: next object_0 object_2. paltry effects delete: vase object_0 object_1.

sip preconditions (must be true): hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, next object_0 object_2, next object_1 object_2. sip effects add: vase object_0 object_1. sip effects delete: next object_0 object_2.

clip preconditions (must be true): hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, next object_0 object_2. clip effects add: vase object_0 object_1. clip effects delete: next object_0 object_2.

wretched preconditions (must be true): sneeze object_0, texture object_1, texture object_2, stupendous object_3, next object_0 object_1, collect object_1 object_3, collect object_2 object_3. wretched effects add: next object_0 object_2. wretched effects delete: next object_0 object_1.

memory preconditions (must be true): cats object_0, spring object_1, spring object_2, next object_0 object_1. memory effects add: next object_0 object_2. memory effects delete: next object_0 object_1.

tightfisted preconditions (must be true): hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, vase object_0 object_1. tightfisted effects add: next object_0 object_2. tightfisted effects delete: vase object_0 object_1.

Scenario A (S1) initial facts: cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_10 object_3, collect object_11 object_3, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_3, hand object_12, next object_0 object_6, next object_1 object_9, next object_12 object_10, next object_4 object_7, next object_5 object_9, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_9, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_10, texture object_11, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Scenario A (S1) goal: next object_12 object_11.

Scenario A (S1) provided plan: wretched object_5 object_9 object_10 object_3; clip object_12 object_5 object_10; wretched object_5 object_10 object_11 object_3; tightfisted object_12 object_5 object_11.

Scenario B (S2) initial facts: cats object_0, collect object_10 object_2, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_1, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_2, hand object_11, hand object_12, next object_0 object_5, next object_11 object_9, next object_12 object_10, next object_3 object_6, next object_4 object_8, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_8, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_10, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Scenario B (S2) goals: next object_11 object_7 and next object_12 object_5.

Constraints and semantics: all actions follow STRIPS-like add and delete lists exactly as specified above; no additional hidden effects are assumed; objects referenced in a plan must be present in the problem objects set.

analyze_plan.system_prompt: You analyze multi-step action sequences against given preconditions and effects. Do not produce PDDL. Validate the Scenario A plan with respect to the stated action schemas and initial facts. Identify which preconditions are satisfied at each step, what effects occur, and whether the final goal holds. If information is missing, flag it without inventing facts.
analyze_plan.prompt: Your name is logician. Use the public information to validate the Scenario A (S1) plan and derive any useful invariants or dependencies that might help achieve Scenario B (S2). Provide a concise, structured assessment: step-by-step feasibility, required linking facts, and any noted conflicts. Base your reasoning only on: {environment->public_information}.

extract_model.system_prompt: You transform informal planning descriptions into normalized, unambiguous specifications. Do not produce PDDL. Instead, return compact lists for: predicates with arities, action schemas with parameter roles and preconditions/effects, the set of objects referenced in Scenario B, and the exact initial facts and goals for Scenario B.
extract_model.prompt: Your name is world_modeler. From the public information, extract a normalized model: list all predicates with argument sorts, provide action schemas (paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted) with parameterized preconditions and effects, enumerate the objects needed for Scenario B, and restate Scenario B initial facts and goals exactly as given. Avoid adding or removing semantics. Base your output strictly on: {environment->public_information}.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in producing PDDL for the FastDownward solver. Integrate the assistants' analyses to produce a final PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem capturing Scenario B. The domain must include the six actions (paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted) with preconditions and effects exactly as specified. Use standard PDDL compatible with FastDownward (classical STRIPS or ADL; avoid derived predicates and numeric fluents). Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Produce a PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem file targeting the FastDownward solver. Use the normalized model and ensure all mentioned objects for Scenario B are included. Predicates: hand(?x), cats(?x), sneeze(?x), spring(?x), stupendous(?x), texture(?x), vase(?x ?y), next(?x ?y), collect(?x ?y). Actions with effects and deletes must match the human description. The problem must encode the Scenario B initial facts and goals: next object_11 object_7 and next object_12 object_5. Keep action names and predicate names lowercase and consistent. Do not invent extra predicates or types unless necessary for typing; using a single type object is acceptable. Output format: first <domain>...</domain>, then <problem>...</problem>. Inputs available: {plan_analysis} and {normalized_spec}.
